source.59e2e69e:
import pandas as pd
import folium
source.106559ef:
traffic_df = pd.read_csv('/kaggle/input/traffic-data-in-minsk/traffic.csv')
traffic_df.loc[:, 'dt'] = pd.to_datetime(traffic_df['dt'])
temp_df = traffic_df[(traffic_df.dt.dt.hour == 10) & (traffic_df.dt.dt.day == 1)]
traffic_df.head()
source.478d8dbe:
#specifying start location ,zoom value,height , width and scale
m = folium.Map(location=[53.893009, 27.567444],zoom_start=12, width=1000, height=1000, control_scale=True)

for i, row in temp_df.iloc[:1000, :].iterrows():
    folium.Marker(
        location=[row['latitude'], row['longitude']],
        popup=f"vehicle_id: {row['vehicle_id']}",
        icon=folium.Icon(color='blue')
    ).add_to(m)
m
source.956f5568:
for col in schedule_df.iloc[:, 7:].columns:
    schedule_df.loc[:, col] = schedule_df.loc[:, col].str.count(' ') + 1
schedule_df = schedule_df.fillna(0)
schedule_df.iloc[:, 7:] = schedule_df.iloc[:, 7:].astype('int')
schedule_df.iloc[:, 7:].head()
source.73994b68: We have a schedule in which the column name is the hour of arrival, and rows are the minutes of the corresponding hour. Let's find the number of vehicles at bus stops per hour!
